title: Procedure-Based Manual Design: An Educational Framework Utilizing Systems Theory and Rhetoric

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental mathematical concepts, professional work experience, and digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Practice-focused course emphasizing systematic design of complex mathematical problem-solving procedures in VR environments

learning_goals: Learners can design mathematical problem-solving procedures using the four-component instructional design framework (goal, prerequisite, unwanted state, action-response)
Learners can evaluate manuals containing warning and troubleshooting information in VR simulations and verify real-world applicability
Learners can create step-by-step instructions for complex mathematical tasks by applying a systems theory-based framework
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
